item.title: Announcing Foundry MCP Server (preview) in the cloud, speeding up AI development with Microsoft Foundry
item.description: MCP (Model Context Protocol) is a standard protocol that enables AI agents to securely connect with apps, data, and systems, supporting easy interoperability and seamless platform expansion. At Ignite, Microsoft Foundry introduced Foundry Too Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/foundry/announcing-foundry-mcp-server-preview-speeding-up-ai-dev-with-microsoft-foundry

item.title: Introducing Data Ingestion Building Blocks (Preview)
item.description: When building AI applications, context is key. AI models have a knowledge cutoff and do not have access to your personal or company data by default. To generate high-quality answers, AI apps need two things: Access to high-quality data The ability to surface the right information at the right time Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/introducing-data-ingestion-building-blocks-preview

item.title: Why changing keyboard shortcuts in Visual Studio isn’t as simple as it seems
item.description: A straight look at what’s behind the keys We’ve all tried unlearning a keyboard shortcut - it feels like forgetting how to breathe. Muscle memory doesn’t mess around. We wrestle with this every time someone suggest a “quick” shortcut change. It’s not just editing a keybinding but navigating a history that makes Visual Stu Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/why-changing-keyboard-shortcuts-in-visual-studio-isnt-as-simple-as-it-seems

item.title: How do I check whether the user has permission to create files in a directory?
item.description: A customer wanted to accept a directory entered by the user and verify that the user has permission to create files in that folder. The directory itself might not even be on a local hard drive; it could be a DVD or a remote network volume. They tried calling Get­File­Attributes, but all they were told was that it was a direct Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251203-00/?p=111836

item.title: The Interaction Changes Everything: Treating AI Agents as Collaborators, Not Automation

The big narrative was about agents as partners in the development lifecycle, moving from tools that assist, to intell Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/engineering-at-microsoft/the-interaction-changes-everything-treating-ai-agents-as-collaborators-not-automation

item.title: Securing Sensitive Mobile Operations with Device-Bound Request Signing
item.description: Mobile security goes beyond verifying user identity. If an attacker steals a valid token, how will your backend distinguish a legitimate request from one reproduced in an emulator or cloned environment? This is a gap in traditional authentication flows when applied to the mobile environment. By linking each request to hardware-backed keys g Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/blog/securing-sensitive-mobile-operations-with-device-bound-request-signing

item.title: Progress on TypeScript 7 - December 2025
item.description: Earlier this year, the TypeScript team announced that we've been porting the compiler and language service to native code to take advantage of better raw performance, memory usage, and parallelism. This effort (codenamed "Project Corsa", and soon "TypeScript 7.0") Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/progress-on-typescript-7-december-2025

item.title: Tata Neu delivers personalized shopping experiences for millions of users with Azure DocumentDB
item.description: With Azure DocumentDB, Tata Neu delivers seamless authentication for millions of users, accelerates credit card onboarding across partners, unifies loyalty programs for hundreds of millions of members, and powers AI-driven support experiences across more than 60 brands. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/tata-neu-delivers-personalized-shopping-experiences-for-millions-of-users-with-azure-documentdb

item.title: Microspeak: Big rocks

item.title: Cross-Platform Age Verification in .NET MAUI Applications
item.description: If you're building apps that need to comply with upcoming age verification requirements in Texas (January 1, 2026), Utah (May 7, 2026), or Louisiana (July 1, 2026), you might be wondering how to handle age verification across Android, iOS, and Windows. The good news? Each platform provides its own age verification APIs, and we've put togeth Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/cross-platform-age-verification-dotnet-maui

item.title: How do I get my edit control text to be autoselected when I choose it to be the default focus in my dialog?
item.description: A customer had a Win32 dialog with a bunch of edit controls inside. In their WM_INIT­DIALOG message handler, they filled those edit controls with information and then decided which one should get initial focus when the dialog is shown to the user. To set the focus, they did SetFocus(GetDlgItem(hDlg, initialCon Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251201-00/?p=111825

item.title: How can I have a Win32 drop-down combo box with a read-only edit control?
item.description: A customer was writing a Win32 program and was looking for something like a combo box, in that it gave the user a choice among various fixed options, but sometimes the program would come up with a new option that wasn't on the list, and it would want to show that as the selection. On the other hand, the customer didn't want to give the user Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251128-00/?p=111820

item.title: Announcing ASP.NET Core OData 10.0.0 Preview 1
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the release of ASP.NET Core OData 10.0.0 Preview 1, a major modernization update that embraces .NET's native System.DateOnly and System.TimeOnly types! This release upgrades to .NET 10.0 and replaces OData's proprietary Edm.Date and Edm.TimeOfDay CL Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/odata/announcing-asp-net-core-odata-10-0-0-preview-1

item.title: Message-only windows are for messaging, not as a convenient victim for hosting UI
item.description: A customer wanted to show a dialog box, but they didn't want it to be attached to any of their existing windows because it was a general dialog that applied to all of their windows. So they had a great idea: Their program already had a message-only window, so they figured, "Hey, I already have this garbage window I can use as the owner of s Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20251127-00/?p=111817
